thread.title: The Who to make up scrapped Joe Louis date on Feb. 27
thread.title_full: The Who to make up scrapped Joe Louis date on Feb. 27

author: detroitnews.com
title: The Who to make up scrapped Joe Louis date on Feb. 27
text:
The Brit rock band will kick off the North American leg of its 50th anniversary tour at Joe Louis Arena GLASTONBURY, ENGLAND - JUNE 28: Roger Daltry of The Who performs on the Pyramid Stage at the Glastonbury Festival at Worthy Farm, Pilton on June 28, 2015 in Glastonbury, England. Now its 45th year the festival is one largest music festivals in the world and this year features headline acts Florence and the Machine, Kanye West and The Who. The Festival, which Michael Eavis started in 1970 when several hundred hippies paid just £1, now attracts more than 175,000 people. (Photo by Ian Gavan/Getty Images) (Photo: Ian Gavan / Getty Images) 
1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE The Who has rescheduled its scrapped fall tour, and the make-up dates will kick off Feb. 27 at Joe Louis Arena, venue officials announced Tuesday.
Earlier this month, the Brit rockers postponed a handful of dates on the North American leg of its 50th anniversary tour, including an Oct. 17 date at Joe Louis Arena, after singer Roger Daltrey was diagnosed with viral meningitis.
“I am now on the mend and feeling a lot better,” Daltrey said in a statement accompanying the new announcement.
The Joe Louis date kicks off a 28-date winter and spring run that wraps up May 29 in Las Vegas.
Tickets for the originally planned Joe Louis show will be honored at the Feb. 27 date.
agraham@detroitnews.com
